verses.text: My breath is corrupt, my days are extinct, the graves \add are ready\add* for me.
\add Are there\add* not mockers with me? and doth not my eye continue in their provocation?
Lay down now, put me in a surety with thee; who \add is\add* he \add that\add* will strike hands with me?
For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: therefore shalt thou not exalt \add them\add* .
He that speaketh flattery to \add his\add* friends, even the eyes of his children shall fail.
He hath made me also a by-word of the people; and in former time I was as a tabret.
My eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, and all my members \add are\add* as a shade.
Upright \add men\add* shall be astonished at this, and the innocent shall stir up himself against the hypocrite.
The righteous also shall hold on his way, and he that hath clean hands shall be stronger and stronger.
But as for you all, do ye return, and come now: for I cannot find \add one\add* wise \add man\add* among you.
My days are past, my purposes are broken off, \add even\add* the thoughts of my heart.
They change the night into day: the light \add is\add* short because of darkness.
If I wait, the grave \add is\add* my house: I have made my bed in the darkness.
I have said to corruption, Thou \add art\add* my father: to the worm, \add Thou art\add* my mother, and my sister.
And where \add is\add* now my hope? as for my hope, who will see it?
They shall go down to the bars of the pit, when \add our\add* rest together \add is\add* in the dust.
